title: Explain Fn+Sync requirement

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=4bc0c9d55bf6300037e374443f31290a)):

```rust
use rayon::prelude::*;

fn main() {
    let mut v = vec![];

    (0..1024).into_par_iter().for_each(|i| v.push(i));
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0596]: cannot borrow `v` as mutable, as it is a captured variable in a `Fn` closure
 --> src/main.rs:6:44
  |
6 |     (0..1024).into_par_iter().for_each(|i| v.push(i));
  |                                            ^ cannot borrow as mutable

error: aborting due to previous error
```

While technically correct, this doesn't guide the beginner in understanding what "a `Fn` closure" is, why this specific closure is "a `Fn` closure", and what the actual underlying problem is, in domain-specific rather than language-specific terms.

Ideally the output would look something like this:

```
error[E0596]: cannot borrow `v` as mutable, as it is a captured variable in a `Fn` closure
 --> src/main.rs:6:44
  |
6 |     (0..1024).into_par_iter().for_each(|i| v.push(i));
  |                               --------     ^ cannot borrow as mutable
  |                               |
  |           expects `Fn` instead of `FnMut`

note: the closure is required to implement `Fn` here
 --> rayon-1.5.1/src/rayon/iter/mod.rs:367:8
    |
    |    fn for_each<OP>(self, op: OP)
    |    where
367 |        OP: Fn(Self::Item) + Sync + Send
    |        ------------------

help: the closure may be invoked concurrently from multiple threads, consider using some
      means of synchronization
```

* It would indicate where the requirement for the closure to implement `Fn` even comes from
* It would state, in straightwordward terms, what the underlying problem is: the code is trying to modify `v` from several threads concurrently. I believe it's safe to say a closure that is required to be `Fn + Sync` "may be invoked concurrently from multiple threads" without special-casing Rayon.

Note: this is a simplified version of a real-life error a beginner has struggled with. Once I told her the actual issue was she was trying to mutate the vector form several threads, she was able to fix it.
